brand.guideline1: Do not stretch, distort, or rotate the logo
brand.guideline2: Maintain adequate spacing around the logo
brand.guideline3: Use the dark logo on light backgrounds and vice versa
brand.guideline4: Do not add effects like shadows or gradients to the logo
brand.guideline5: The logo should be clearly visible against the background

prompts.title: Prompts
prompts.skillsDescription: Agent Skills are multi-file prompts that give AI agents specialized capabilities. They include instructions, configurations, and supporting files that can be used with Claude, Cursor, Windsurf, and other AI coding assistants.
prompts.createInfo: This platform doesn't run or execute prompts — it's a community-driven library for sharing and discovering AI prompts. Create your prompt here, and others can copy and use it in their preferred AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, or any other LLM. The community can also comment on your prompts and suggest improvements through change requests.

prompts.delistReasonLowQuality: This prompt was automatically delisted due to quality issues. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonNotInstruction: This prompt was automatically delisted because it doesn't appear to be an LLM instruction. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.
prompts.delistReasonManual: This prompt was manually delisted by an administrator. It will still appear on your profile, but won't be exported to GitHub and won't appear in searches.

support.title: Support
support.description: Find answers to common questions or get help from our community.

whatIsPrompt.question: What is a prompt?
whatIsPrompt.answer: A prompt is an instruction or input you give to an AI model (like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) to guide its response. It's essentially how you communicate what you want the AI to do. Well-crafted prompts lead to better, more useful outputs from AI systems.

whyPromptsMatter.question: Why do prompts matter? Can't I just ask the AI anything?
whyPromptsMatter.answer:
While advanced AI models can handle casual questions well, prompts become critical when:

• Using AI via API in applications — you often get only one chance to get it right ("one-shot prompting"), with no back-and-forth dialogue
• Working with smaller, cost-effective models that need more precise instructions
• Building production systems where consistency and reliability matter

Optimized prompts help you get better results, save tokens (and money), and create more reliable AI-powered applications.

whatIsPromptschat.question: What is prompts.chat?
whatIsPromptschat.answer: prompts.chat is a community-driven platform where people share, discover, and collect AI prompts. For over 4 years, users have been sharing their prompt optimization techniques here. The community helps each other improve their prompts and learn new approaches to working with AI systems.

howToUse.question: How do I use prompts from this platform?
howToUse.answer: Simply browse the prompts, find one you like, and copy it. You can then paste it into your preferred AI tool (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.) or use it in your applications via API. Many prompts include variables you can customize before copying.

license.question: Can I use these prompts commercially?
license.answer: Yes! All prompts on prompts.chat are released under the CC0 (Creative Commons Zero) license, which means they are in the public domain. You can use, modify, and distribute them freely for any purpose, including commercial use, without attribution.

selfHost.question: Can I self-host this platform?
selfHost.answer: Absolutely! prompts.chat is fully open source. You can deploy your own private instance for your team or organization. Check out our self-hosting documentation for setup instructions.

verification.question: How can I become a verified user?
verification.answer: Verification is granted by administrators to users who consistently share quality prompts. There are no strict rules — if you contribute valuable prompts to the community, an admin may select you as verified. Focus on creating helpful, well-crafted prompts and the recognition will follow.

aiCredits.question: How do AI preview generation credits work?
aiCredits.answer: Each user receives 3 AI generation credits per day by default. These credits allow you to generate preview images, videos, or audio for your prompts using AI. Administrators can adjust the daily credit limit for individual users if needed.

attribution.question: What if the attribution on a prompt is wrong?
attribution.answer: If you notice incorrect attribution on a prompt (for example, if you're the original author but not credited), please open an issue on our GitHub repository. You can use the form below to submit your issue, and we'll review and correct it as soon as possible.

contact.title: Need More Help?
contact.description: If you couldn't find an answer to your question, fill out the form below and we'll help you on GitHub.

form.title: Issue Title
form.titlePlaceholder: Brief summary of your issue or question
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe your issue or question in detail...

connectedPrompts.addNextDescription: Select a prompt that comes after this one in the workflow.
connectedPrompts.noConnections: No connected prompts yet. Add connections to create a prompt chain.

connectedPrompts.labelHint: Describe the condition or transition between prompts
connectedPrompts.fillAllFields: Please select a prompt and enter a label

promptWritingGuide.title: How to Write Great Prompts
promptWritingGuide.subtitle: Tips, examples, and best practices for creating effective AI prompts

interactiveBanner.title: Want a More Detailed & Interactive Experience?
interactiveBanner.description: Dive deeper with our comprehensive interactive guide featuring 25 chapters, hands-on exercises, and real-world examples to master AI prompting.

beSpecific.title: Be Specific and Clear
beSpecific.description: Vague prompts lead to vague responses. Specify exactly what you want, including format, length, tone, and any constraints.

provideContext.title: Provide Context
provideContext.description: Give background information that helps the AI understand your needs. Include who, what, why, and for whom.

defineFormat.title: Define the Output Format
defineFormat.description: Specify how you want the response structured: bullet points, paragraphs, code blocks, tables, etc.

setConstraints.title: Set Constraints
setConstraints.description: Include limitations like word count, reading level, things to avoid, or specific requirements to follow.

includeExamples.title: Include Examples
includeExamples.description: Show the AI what good output looks like. Examples help calibrate the response style and quality.

rolePlaying.title: Role-Playing: "Act As" Patterns
rolePlaying.description: One of the most powerful prompting techniques is assigning the AI a specific role or persona. This helps establish expertise, tone, and perspective.

variables.title: Using Variables for Dynamic Prompts
variables.description: Variables make your prompts reusable and customizable. Users can fill in different values each time they use your prompt.
variables.tip1: Use descriptive variable names: '$'{topic} is better than '$'{x}
variables.tip2: Provide sensible defaults for optional values
variables.tip3: Group related variables together in your prompt

structured.title: Structured Prompts (JSON/YAML)
structured.description: Structured prompts use JSON or YAML format to organize complex instructions clearly. They're ideal for multi-step workflows, agents, and detailed configurations.
structured.tip1: Use JSON for programmatic use; YAML for human-readable configs
structured.tip2: Keep nesting shallow (2-3 levels max) for readability
structured.tip3: Include comments in YAML to explain complex sections
structured.tip4: Validate your JSON/YAML syntax before saving

outputOptimization.title: Output Optimization
outputOptimization.description: Guide the AI to produce exactly the format and style you need by being explicit about your requirements.
outputOptimization.lengthExample: "Keep response under 200 words" / "Provide exactly 5 bullet points"
outputOptimization.styleExample: "Use simple language suitable for beginners" / "Be technical and precise"
outputOptimization.contentExample: "Do not include personal opinions" / "Focus only on factual information"

about.title: About prompts.chat
about.description: The story behind the first-ever AI prompts library, created 2 weeks after ChatGPT was announced.
about.story1Rich: prompts.chat is the web visualization of the <repoLink>Awesome ChatGPT Prompts</repoLink> repository. It started as a personal project by <authorLink>@f</authorLink> to keep ChatGPT prompts organized, back when ChatGPT had no history feature in its initial version.
about.story2: The Awesome ChatGPT Prompts repository was created on December 5, 2022, just 2 weeks after ChatGPT was first announced to the world. What began as a simple solution became the go-to resource for millions of AI enthusiasts.
about.testimonialsRich: Loved by AI pioneers, including OpenAI co-founders <gregLink>Greg Brockman</gregLink> and <wojciechLink>Wojciech Zaremba</wojciechLink>.
about.openSource: Completely free and open source from day one.
about.goal1Rich: We believe in the power of sharing. Our mission is to make <bold>AI context engineering techniques shared by millions</bold>, from the community, to everyone.
about.goal2Rich: Every prompt, every technique, every insight shared here belongs to humanity. That's why we chose the <licenseLink>CC0 (Public Domain)</licenseLink> license: no restrictions, no attribution required. Just pure knowledge for all.
about.goal3: Whether you're a student learning AI, a developer building the next breakthrough, or simply curious about what's possible: this is your library. Use it, share it, build upon it.
about.githubStars: <link>141k+ GitHub stars</link>, most starred prompts repository
about.usedByDevelopers: Used by thousands of developers worldwide
about.supportUsIntro: We build this as a non-commercial, CC-0 project and ask for nothing in return. We've kept it running thanks to our amazing sponsors. To help me keep developing this product, please consider supporting.
about.githubSponsorsDescription: Become a $800/month sponsor on GitHub and get your logo featured on the homepage.
about.supportersDescription: Subscribe for $9.99/month to keep the community running, get a verified badge, and see your name on the wall. Cancel anytime.

book.title: The Interactive Book of Prompting
book.subtitle: An Interactive Guide to Crafting Clear and Effective Prompts
book.metaTitle: The Interactive Book of Prompting | Free Online Guide to AI Prompt Engineering
book.metaDescription: Master AI prompt engineering with this free, interactive guide. Learn ChatGPT prompts, chain-of-thought reasoning, few-shot learning, and advanced techniques. 25+ chapters with real examples.
book.authorIntro: Hi, I'm <author>Fatih Kadir Akın</author>, the curator of the popular <repoLink>Awesome ChatGPT Prompts</repoLink> repository on GitHub and <siteName>prompts.chat</siteName>.
book.bookDescription: In this comprehensive and interactive guide, you'll discover expert strategies for crafting compelling AI prompts that drive engaging and effective conversations. From understanding how AI models work to mastering advanced techniques like prompt chaining and agentic systems, this book provides you with the tools you need to take your AI interactions to the next level.

highlights.understanding: Understanding how AI models think and process prompts
highlights.crafting: Crafting clear, specific, and effective prompts
highlights.advanced: Advanced techniques: chain-of-thought, few-shot learning, and prompt chaining
highlights.interactive: Interactive examples you can try directly in the browser
highlights.realWorld: Real-world use cases for writing, coding, education, and business
highlights.future: The future of prompting: agents and agentic systems

book.continuousUpdate: This book is continuously updated with new techniques and insights as AI evolves.
book.partOfProject: Part of the <repoLink>Awesome ChatGPT Prompts</repoLink> project. Licensed under CC0.

kidsSection.question: Are you a school teacher or a parent?
kidsSection.title: Try our Playable Book for Kids! 🎮
kidsSection.description: An interactive, game-based adventure to teach children (ages 8-14) how to communicate with AI through fun puzzles and stories.

chapterDescriptions.00a-preface: A personal note from the author
chapterDescriptions.00b-history: The story of Awesome ChatGPT Prompts
chapterDescriptions.00c-introduction: What is prompt engineering and why it matters
chapterDescriptions.13-multimodal-prompting: Working with images, audio, and video
chapterDescriptions.14-context-engineering: RAG, embeddings, function calling, and MCP
chapterDescriptions.25-agents-and-skills: Building AI agents with reusable skill packages

interactive.watchHowAIPredicts: Watch how AI predicts the next token at each step
interactive.howItWorksExplanation: At each step, the model calculates probabilities for all possible next tokens (~50,000+). The highest probability token is selected, then the process repeats.
interactive.seeHowTextIsSplit: See how text is split into tokens
interactive.tryExamples: Try: "Unbelievable", "ChatGPT is amazing" or type your own
interactive.contextOverflowMessage: Your prompt + response exceeds the context window. The model will truncate or fail. Try reducing your prompt length or requesting shorter responses.
interactive.contextTip: Both your prompt AND the AI's response must fit in the context window. Longer prompts leave less room for responses. Put important information at the start of your prompt.
interactive.unreliableBreaksWithChanges: Unreliable, breaks with slight wording changes
interactive.defineStructureWithTypeScript: Define the structure with TypeScript interfaces
interactive.machineReadableStrictSyntax: Machine-readable, strict syntax, great for APIs
interactive.humanReadableSupportsComments: Human-readable, supports comments, great for config
interactive.successMessage: The prompt now produces high-quality, consistent output.
interactive.selectOptionsToBuiltImagePrompt: Select options from each category to build an image prompt:
interactive.diffusionExplanation: Real diffusion models run thousands of steps, gradually removing noise until a coherent image emerges.
interactive.videoPromptsNeed: Video prompts need motion, camera work, and timing:
interactive.consistencyDesc: Subject stays the same across frames
interactive.videoModelExplanation: Real video models generate 24-60 frames per second with photorealistic detail and consistent subjects.
interactive.clickWordToSeeVector: Click a word to see its vector and similarity to other words:
interactive.embeddingsExplanation: Words with similar meanings (like "happy" and "joyful") have similar vectors and get high similarity scores.

tokenPrediction.fullText: The capital of France is Paris.

tokenizer.tryExamples: Try the examples or type your own text

temperature.prompt: What is the capital of France?
lowTemp: The capital of France is Paris.
The capital of France is Paris.
The capital of France is Paris.
mediumLowTemp: The capital of France is Paris.
Paris is the capital of France.
The capital of France is Paris, a major European city.
mediumHighTemp: Paris serves as the capital of France.
The capital of France is Paris, home to the Eiffel Tower.
France's capital is the historic and romantic city of Paris.
highTemp: Paris, the City of Light, proudly stands as France's magnificent capital!
France's romantic capital is none other than the enchanting city of Paris.
The heart of France beats in Paris, its beloved capital of art and culture.
